data.title: Ten Best Recipients of the Dadasaheb Phalke Award
data.text:
L.V. Prasad (1982)

One of the oldest recipients of the award for his contribution in Hindi, Telugu, Tamil, and Kannada cinema

Akkineni Nagesawara Rao (1990)

A pioneer in Telugu cinema, he was also the recipient of the prestigious Padma Vibhushan

Sivaji Ganesan (1996)

The veteran actor was the first person from the Tamil film industry to be honoured with the award

Asha Bhosle (2000)

The immensely talented and versatile singer has provided her voice in over a 1000 movies

Yash Chopra (2001)

The iconic director/producer is considered to be one of the best filmmakers of the country

Adoor Gopalakrishnan (2004)

Also conferred with the National Film Award 16 times, he is undoubtedly a pioneer in Malayalam cinema

D. Ramanaidu (2009)

The veteran producer holds the Guinness World Record for producing films in 13 Indian languages

K. Balachander (2010)

The legendary filmmaker is credited with guiding some of the most celebrated actors of the country, including Rajinikanth and Kamal Haasan

Amitabh Bachchan (2018)

Referred to as the 'Greatest Actor of the Century' in Bollywood, Bachchan has appeared in over 200 films in 5 decades
